item.title: Corner text
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Sorry. I was the one who fixed that bug.

Here you go.

Change:

public void writePlayers() { int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(); sendFrame126("", 13589); sendFrame126("", 13590); sendFrame126("@whi@SERVER NAME HERE", 13591); sendFrame126("@gre@OWNER = YOUR NAME HERE", 13592); sendFrame126("@whi@ PIC ANYTHNG TO SAY HERE ", 13593); sendFrame126("@cya@Players Online: "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(), 13594); setInterfaceWalkable(13588); }

To:

public void writePlayers() { int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(); sendFrame126("", 13589); sendFrame126("", 13590); sendFrame126("@whi@SERVER NAME HERE", 13591); sendFrame126("@gre@OWNER = YOUR NAME HERE", 13592); sendFrame126("@whi@ PIC ANYTHNG TO SAY HERE ", 13593); sendFrame126("@cya@Players Online: "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(), 13594); sendFrame126("", 13595); sendFrame126("", 13596); sendFrame126("", 13597); sendFrame126("", 13598); sendFrame126("", 13599); sendFrame126("", 13600); setInterfaceWalkable(13588); }

I found this out when I did it.

It was actually a really simple fix.

Read full topic

item.title: Corner text
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Here ya go.

Search for:

Player implements Runnable {

After the { add this void with the others:

public void writePlayers() { int players = PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(); sendFrame126("", 13589); sendFrame126("", 13590); sendFrame126("@whi@SERVER NAME HERE", 13591); sendFrame126("@gre@OWNER = YOUR NAME HERE", 13592); sendFrame126("@whi@ PIC ANYTHNG TO SAY HERE ", 13593); sendFrame126("@cya@Players Online: "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(), 13594); setInterfaceWalkable(13588); }

Now search for:

public boolean process() {

After the last { add this this:

writePlayers();

Now it should look like this:

public boolean process() { writePlayers(); // is being called regularily every 500ms

Save and compile. Happy to help.

Read full topic
